publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-811 Patricia Ferguson: Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid—That the Parliament applauds the decision by the Commonwealth Games Federation to award the 2014 Commonwealth Games to Glasgow; notes the sterling efforts of the partners involved in securing the games and the support of people all over Scotland and beyond, and recognises that the games will boost interest and participation in sport and contribute significantly to the regeneration of the east end of Glasgow and provide a legacy for the whole country. Supported by: Hugh O’Donnell*, Andy Kerr*, Marlyn Glen*, Mary Mulligan*, Stuart McMillan*, Elaine Murray*, Bob Doris*, Iain Gray*, Jackie Baillie*, Rhona Brankin*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Sarah Boyack*, Hugh Henry*, David Whitton*, John Park*, Robin Harper*, Bill Butler*, Mike Pringle*, Pauline McNeill*, Charlie Gordon*, Ross Finnie*, Robert Brown*

S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Alasdair Allan*, Mary Scanlon*, John Lamont*, Jamie Hepburn*, James Kelly*, Karen Whitefield*, Liam McArthur*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Ken Macintosh*, Bill Aitken*, Trish Godman*, Christine Grahame*, Cathie Craigie*
S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Mr Frank McAveety*, Jack McConnell*
S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Cathy Peattie*
S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Irene Oldfather*
S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Peter Peacock*
S3M-811 Scotland’s Successful Commonwealth Games Bid (lodged on 9 November 2007) Rhoda Grant*
